sagma.core.data.generator.color
Class ColorGenerator

java.lang.Object
  sagma.core.data.generator.color.ColorGenerator
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConstantColorGenerator
public class ColorGenerator
extends java.lang.Object


Automatically generates a new Color instance every time a Color is requested.
This class can be used to generate complex varieties of colors.
If no variety of color is needed or wanted consider using ConstantColorGenerator.

For example if you wanted a Color field to return any shade of red, but only red
you could use the following:

NumberGenerator reds = new RandomNumberGenerator(0.0f, 1.0f);
NumberGenerator greens = new ConstantNumberGenerator(0.0f);
NumberGenerator blues = new ConstantNumberGenerator(0.0f);
new ColorGenerator(reds, greens, blues);

For another example if you want a grayscale color to slowly increase each time

NumberGenerator reds = new LinearNumberGenerator(0.0f, 0.01f, 1.0f);
NumberGenerator greens = new LinearNumberGenerator(0.0f, 0.01f, 1.0f);
NumberGenerator blues = new LinearNumberGenerator(0.0f, 0.01f, 1.0f);
new ColorGenerator(reds, greens, blues);

Note in the last example that if the color gets called 100 times, which brings the
gray value from 0.0 to 1.0, then the color will loop again starting at 0.

Author:
Aaron Kison
